Subsection.Text: If any of the grounds for rehabilitation, liquidation, conservation, reorganization, seizure, or summary proceedings of an insurer as set forth in ss. 631.051, 631.061, and 631.071 exist as to a company, the office may petition for an appropriate court order or may pursue such other relief as is afforded in part I of chapter 631.

In the event an order of rehabilitation, liquidation, conservation, reorganization, seizure, or summary proceedings has been entered against a company, the department and office shall be vested with all of the powers and duties they have under the provisions of part I of chapter 631 in regard to delinquency proceedings of insurance companies.
